required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: One-Lung Ventilation in the Morbidly Obese Patient: Comparison of Double Lumen Versus Bronchial Blockers
clinical_study.official_title: One-Lung Ventilation in Morbidly Obese Patients:

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the double-lumen endotracheal tube or the standard single-lumen tracheal tube, with an Arndt® blocker, is superior in providing one lung ventilation during thoracic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare a double lumen tube versus the standard single-lumen tracheal tube, with an Arndt® blocker, in the morbidly obese patient who requires one-lung ventilation during surgery. The objects is to determine which device is best for intubation and is most effective in terms of optimal positioning of the device, of lung collapse, and quality of lung isolation.

primary_outcome.measure: Time Taken for Endotracheal Tube Placement Procedure.
primary_outcome.time_frame: This measurement occurred after the patient was in the operating room and the randomization group was determined. This measurement began and ended during the intubation procedure.
primary_outcome.description: For each group, the time in minutes required for the anesthesiologist to successfully place the endotracheal tube. Intubation time was recorded as the time from when the tracheal tube passed the vocal cords until the anesthetist concluded that the DLT (Arm 1) or the single-lumen tube with the Arndt blocker (Arm 2) was correctly placed and optimal position was confirmed with the fiberoptic bronchoscope.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in Which the Tube Was Successfully Positioned at First Attempt
primary_outcome.time_frame: This data measure was occurred during surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants in each group in which the tube was successfully positioned at first attempt

secondary_outcome.time_frame: This measure occured during surgery just after intubation.
secondary_outcome.description: For each group, the number of participants in which lung collapse was evaluated as: (i) good—complete collapse without surgical interference, (ii) fair—total collapse, but with residual air, and (iii) poor—no or partial collapse, lung inflated and interfering with the surgical exposure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time Required to Collapse the Lung
secondary_outcome.description: For each group, the mean time for lung isolation/collapse was measured from the institution of one-lung ventilation to the time of total lung collapse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Successful Reinflation
secondary_outcome.description: In each group, the number of Participants in which successful lung reinflation occurred.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Intraoperative Oxygenation During One-lung Ventilation
secondary_outcome.description: For each group, the mean intraoperative oxygenation (arterial partial pressure of oxygen measured by arterial blood gases) were taken during two-lung ventilation (baseline) and after 30 min of one-lung ventilation.

arm_group.description: We used a device called a double lumen tube ( DLT Broncho-Cath®). It is a bifurcated endotracheal tube designed to independently collapse the operated lung.

We used a device called a bronchial blocker (9 Fr Arndt® blocker) along with a standard single-lumen tracheal tube (8.0-9.0 mm ID). The Arndt bronchial blocker is a single device, with a distal balloon that is passed thru the single lumen endotracheal once the patient is intubated. The Arndt bronchial blocker is designed to collapse the operated lung.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject undergoing thoracic or esophageal surgery requiring one-lung ventilation.
2. Subject is >18 years of age.
3. Subject's BMI > 35.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject < 18 years of age.
2. Subject's BMI < 35.

clinical_study.keyword: One-lung ventilation in the morbidly obese patient

group.title: Double Lumen Endotracheal Tube
group.description: Double Lumen Endotracheal Tube This group was one arm of this research to determine the advantages of this group versus a comparative bronchial blocker group. We assessed 56 subjects and enrolled 50. A total of 6 were excluded because they did not meet criteria (4) or refused to participate (2).

group.title: Arndt Bronchial Blocker
group.description: Arndt Bronchial Blocker We assessed 56 subjects and enrolled 50. A total of 6 were excluded because they did not meet criteria (4) or refused to participate (2).

group.title: Double Lumen Endotracheal Tube
group.description: Double Lumen Endotracheal Tube Device where lung collapse can be achieved by clamping one of the lumens (the operated lung) 25 subjects were enrolled in this group

group.title: Arndt Bronchial Blocker
group.description: Arndt Bronchial Blocker in conjunction with a single lumen endotracheal tube. Device that allows collapse of one lung (the operated lung). 25 subjects were enrolled in this group

measure.title: double lumen tubes versus bronchial blockers
Body Mass Index
measure.description: Body Mass Index of obesity or being underweight. It is body weight divided by body height squared (BMI=kg/m^2)

outcome.title: Time Taken for Endotracheal Tube Placement Procedure.
outcome.description: For each group, the time in minutes required for the anesthesiologist to successfully place the endotracheal tube. Intubation time was recorded as the time from when the tracheal tube passed the vocal cords until the anesthetist concluded that the DLT (Arm 1) or the single-lumen tube with the Arndt blocker (Arm 2) was correctly placed and optimal position was confirmed with the fiberoptic bronchoscope.
outcome.time_frame: This measurement occurred after the patient was in the operating room and the randomization group was determined. This measurement began and ended during the intubation procedure.

group.title: Double Lumen Endotracheal Tube
group.description: Left-sided double lumen endotracheal tube Broncho-Cath®

group.title: Arndt Bronchial Blocker
group.description: Arndt® blocker group: Intubation with a standard single-lumen tracheal tube (8.0–9.0 mm ID) followed by the passage of a 9 Fr Arndt® spherical blocker

measure.title: Time Taken for Endotracheal Tube Placement Procedure.

Intubation time was recorded as the time from when the tracheal tube passed the vocal cords until the anesthetist concluded that the DLT (Arm 1) or the single-lumen tube with the Arndt blocker (Arm 2) was correctly placed and optimal position was confirmed with the fiberoptic bronchoscope.

event.sub_title: failure to intubate at first attempt
event.description: failure to intubate at first attempt
there were no complications or adverse events related to this study

event.sub_title: low PaO2 was seen in two patients one in each group and required Continuous positive airway pressure
event.description: low Pao2 that was seen in one patient in each group and it was corrected with continuous positive airway pressure ventilation

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
